Header: Wholesale price of vegetables growing by leaps and bounds
Content: The Dambulla Economic Centre says that the wholesale prices of a number of vegetables in the market have increased to over Rs.300 a kilogramme. The wholesale price of a kilogramme of Beans, Carrots, Leeks, Banana, Peppers have increased to over Rs.300 per kilogramme at the Dambulla Economic Centre. In addition,  the prices of a low country vegetables such as Bittergourd , Brinjals and Snakegourd have increased to a price between Rs.130 – 200  a kilogramme. It is observed that when  wholesale market prices reach such a level, the prices in the retail market increase by a further Rs. 100. Farmers point out that the reason for the sharp increase in vegetable prices was the destruction of crops by the incessant downpour experienced in the recent days.
